japanese: こんなイベントがあったなんてね。
translation: I didn't know there was this kind of an event.

japanese:
う～ん、惜しかったな。
先にわかってれば、
スケジュールを調整できたかもしれないのに。
translation:
Hmm, too bad.
If we had known earlier,
we might have been able to adjust the schedule.

japanese: ２人して、なんのポスターを見てるんだ？
translation: What posters are the two of you looking at?

japanese: あっ、フー君！
translation: Ah, Fu-kun!

japanese:
やっぱり私に会いに来てくれたんだ？
ふふ、嬉しい。
translation:
You came to see me after all?
Hehe, I'm happy.

japanese:
別にそんなつもりじゃ……。
たまたま通りかかっただけで……。
translation:
It's not like I came to see you on purpose...
I was just passing by...

japanese:
あれ？
フータロー君が会いに来たのは私だよね？
translation:
Hm?
You came to see me, right, Futaro-kun?

japanese: ちょっ……。
translation: Wait a sec...

japanese:
照れてる照れてる。
そういうとこ、可愛いぞ？
translation:
You're so shy.
It's really cute, you know?

japanese:
ったく……。
つか、一花は琉球ガラスの店に行くとか
言ってなかったか？
translation:
Geez...
Anyway, didn't you say
you were going to the Ryukyu Glass shop, Ichika?

japanese:
そうなんだけど、君と同じく
二乃が見てたポスターが気になっちゃって。
translation:
Yeah, but just like you,
I got interested in the poster Nino was looking at.

japanese:
へえ、花火大会のポスターか。
開催は４月中旬――
translation:
Oh, the fireworks festival poster.
The festival is held in mid-April%p-2;――

japanese:
って、早っ！？
なんだそれ、まだ春だろ？
translation:
Wait, what?! That's too early!
It's still spring, isn't it?

japanese:
日本で一番早い花火大会なんだって。
さすがは沖縄、どこよりも早く夏を先取りだ。
translation:
It's the earliest fireworks festival in Japan.
As expected of Okinawa,
they get a head start on summer before anyone else.

japanese:
会場が海岸近くだし、
きっと花火が海面に映って綺麗なんでしょうね。
できれば見たかったわ。
translation:
The venue is near the beach, so I'm sure
the fireworks would reflect on the sea and
look beautiful. I really wanted to see it if I could.

japanese:
でも、４月中旬だと時期的に
フータロー君は上京しちゃってるよね？
translation:
But if it's in mid-April,
you'll already be in Tokyo by then,
won't you, Futaro-kun?

japanese: ああ、そうなっちまうな。
translation: Yeah, that's right.

japanese: じゃあ、一緒に花火を見るのは夏までお預けかぁ。
translation:
Then, we'll have to put off watching fireworks together
until summer.

japanese:
長期の休みには帰省するつもりだし、
地元の花火大会になら顔を出せると思うが。
translation:
I'm planning to go back home for a long vacation,
so I think I can make it
to the local fireworks festival.

japanese: ねえ、今年の花火は私と２人で見るとかどう？
translation:
Hey, how about the two of us
watch the fireworks together this year?

japanese: なんで２人きりなんだ。
translation: Why just the two of us?

japanese:
なんでって。
……言わせたいの？
translation:
Why?
...Do you really want me to say it?

japanese:
じゃなくて。
せっかくなんだし６人で行けばいいだろ。
translation:
It's not that.
It's just that since we have the chance,
why don't all six of us go together?

japanese: ふーん、６人でね。
translation: Hmm, all six of us, huh.

japanese:
でも、私とフー君、
２人で見る花火があってもいいんじゃないかしら。
translation:
But, Fu-kun, I think there should be times
when we watch fireworks, just the two of us.

japanese:
花火なんて１回見れば充分だろ。
それより勉強のほうが重要だ。
translation:
You only need to see fireworks once to be satisfied,
right? Studying is more important than that.

japanese:
ふ～ん。
せっかく女の子に誘われてるのに
勉強を優先しちゃうとは。
translation:
Hmmph.
Even though you're being invited by a girl,
you're prioritizing studying.

japanese: ……大学生になったって勉強は大事ってことだ。
translation:
Well...as a university student,
studying is the most important.

japanese: そうは言うけど、本当の理由は別なんじゃない？
translation: But, is there another reason behind it?

japanese:
私たち、花火大会がある頃――
今年の夏はどんな過ごし方をしてるのかしらね。
translation:
By the time the fireworks festival comes around...
I wonder how we'll be spending this summer.

japanese: 遠慮しておく。
translation: I'll pass.

japanese:
えー、なんでさ。
即答されるとさすがに傷ついちゃうな。
translation:
Whaaat? Why?
Such an immediate response really hurts, you know.

japanese:
いや、お前、自分の立場を考えろよ。
女優が男と２人で歩いてたら大騒ぎだろうが。
translation:
Well, you should consider your position.
If an actress was walking with a man,
people would make a big fuss.

japanese: ああ、そういうことね。
translation: Ah, that's what you mean.

japanese:
それは建前で、実は他に
２人で歩きたい相手がいたり……なんてあるのかな？
translation:
I wonder if that's just a front, and actually,
there's someone else you want to walk with...
could that be it?

japanese:
どうかしら、フー君？
私と２人で見る花火があってもいいんじゃない？
translation:
How about it, Fu-kun?
I think there should be times
when we watch fireworks, just the two of us.

japanese:
花火なんて１回見れば充分だろ。
それより勉強のほうが重要だ。
translation:
You only need to see fireworks once to be satisfied,
right? Studying is more important than that.

japanese:
ふ～ん。
せっかく女の子に誘われてるのに
勉強を優先しちゃうとは。
translation:
Hmmph.
Even though you're being invited by a girl,
you're prioritizing studying.

japanese: ……大学生になったって勉強は大事ってことだ。
translation:
Well...as a university student,
studying is the most important.

japanese: そうは言うけど、本当の理由は別なんじゃない？
translation: But, is there another reason behind it?

japanese:
私たち、花火大会がある頃――
今年の夏はどんな過ごし方をしてるのかしらね。
translation:
By the time the fireworks festival comes around...
I wonder how we'll be spending this summer.

japanese:
花火は姉妹５人揃って、だろ？
お母さんとの思い出だって聞いたぜ？
translation:
Shouldn't it be with all five of you?
I heard that's a memory of you and your mother.

japanese: ……うん、そうなんだけどさ。
translation: ...Yes, that is true.

japanese:
もちろん姉妹５人でも見るわ。
でも花火大会は１つじゃないもの。
translation:
Of course,
we'll watch them as a group of five.
But there's more than one fireworks festival, you know?

japanese:
私とフー君、２人で見る花火があっても
いいんじゃないかしら。
translation:
Fu-kun, I think there should be times
when we watch fireworks, just the two of us.

japanese:
花火なんて１回見れば充分だろ。
それより勉強のほうが重要だ。
translation:
You only need to see fireworks once to be satisfied,
right? Studying is more important than that.

japanese:
ふ～ん。
せっかく女の子に誘われてるのに
勉強を優先しちゃうとは。
translation:
Hmmph.
Even though you're being invited by a girl,
you're prioritizing studying.

japanese: ……大学生になったって勉強は大事ってことだ。
translation:
Well...as a university student,
studying is the most important.

japanese: そうは言うけど、本当の理由は別なんじゃない？
translation: But, is there another reason behind it?

japanese:
私たち、花火大会がある頃――
今年の夏はどんな過ごし方をしてるのかしらね。
translation:
By the time the fireworks festival comes around...
I wonder how we'll be spending this summer.

japanese:
高校を卒業して、それぞれ別の進路へと進んだんだ。
いままでとはまったく違うものになるんだろうな。
translation:
After graduating high school,
our lives will all go separate ways. Summer will be
completely different from what it used to be, huh.

japanese:
きっとこれからは、
みんなで集まれる機会も減っていくんだろうね。
translation:
I'm sure there will be fewer opportunities
for us all to get together.

japanese: ……そうね。
translation: ...That's true.

japanese:
変わっちまうものもあるが、
変わらないものだってある。
translation:
There may be things that'll change,
but there are things that won't.

japanese:
俺たちの関係だって、
出会った頃に比べたらすっかり変わっただろ？
translation:
Our relationship has changed a lot
since we first met, right?

japanese:
しかし、俺たちが
一緒に過ごしてきた時間は変わらない。
それがあるからこそ、いまがあるんだしな。
translation:
Yet, the time we've spent together hasn't changed.
That's the reason why we're here.

japanese:
フー君と一緒に花火大会に行った時は大変だったわ。
みんなバラバラになっちゃって。
translation:
It was tough when we went
to the fireworks festival together.
Everyone got scattered.

japanese: ああ、あの時はフータロー君に助けられたなぁ。
translation:
Yeah, I remember being helped out
by Futaro-kun at that time.

japanese: いまとなっては、それもいい思い出だ。
translation: Looking back, it's a good memory.

japanese:
俺たちがどう変わるのかはわからないが……
きっと、これからも思い出を作っていくんだろうな。
translation:
We don't know how we'll change in the future...
but we'll surely continue to make memories.

japanese:
ふ～ん？
思い出、作ってくれるんだ？
translation: Hmm? You'll make memories with us?

japanese:
ね、フー君。
夏休みには帰省してくれるのよね？
translation:
Hey, Fu-kun.
You'll be coming back for summer vacation, right?

japanese:
その時は、また一緒に花火を見ましょ！
他にもお買い物したり海に行ったり……。
translation:
Let's watch fireworks together again!
And go shopping or go to the beach...

japanese:
一緒にしたいことはたくさんあるから。
しっかり予定を空けておいてよね？
translation:
There are just so many things I want to do together,
so make sure to clear your schedule!

japanese: いまからそんな先のこと言われても、わからねぇよ。
translation:
It's hard to know what the future holds,
even if they're talking about summer vacation plans.

japanese:
あっ、そうだ！
いっそ、私がフータロー君のところへ行って
東京を案内してもらおっかな。
translation:
Ah, I just had an idea!
Why don't I go to your place, Futaro-kun,
and have you show me around Tokyo?

japanese:
はっ！？　ちょっと一花！
そんな抜けがけ許さないわよ？
translation:
HUH?! Hold on, Ichika!
I won't allow you to just cut in like that.

japanese:
お、おい、勝手に話を進めないでくれ。
俺にだって都合ってもんが――
translation:
H-hey, don't just go on assuming things
without considering my schedule%p-2;――

japanese:
え～？
だって、私は仕事で東京に行ったりするし。
それくらい役得があってもいいんじゃない？
translation:
Huh?
But I have to go to Tokyo for work sometimes.
Isn't it a good idea to have some perks like that?

japanese:
なら私も遊びに行くわ。
なんなら毎月行ってもいいわよ？
translation:
Well then, I'll come along too.
I could even go every month if I wanted to.

japanese: （俺の話を聞いてない……）
translation: (They're not even listening to me...)

japanese:
（このまま話を進められるとまずい気がする。
　ここはいったん、この場から離れておくか）
